title: Wild vs. Controlled Fermentation
description: A short lesson to help you apply Wild vs. Controlled Fermentation.

hook.text: Leave apple cider on a counter and it ferments on its own. But the result is unpredictable â€” and risky.

buildup.text: Wild fermentation relies on whatever microbes are present â€” on the food surface, in the air, on your hands.

discovery.text: Controlled fermentation uses specific starter cultures â€” chosen strains that produce consistent, safe results.

twist.text: Some wild ferments are prized. Natural wine and sourdough depend on unpredictable microbial diversity.

climax.text: The trade-off is consistency vs. complexity. Industry prefers control; artisans prefer wildness.

punchline.text: Wild ferments gamble on chaos. Controlled ferments bet on certainty.

quiz.question: What distinguishes wild fermentation from controlled fermentation?
options: Wild relies on ambient microbes; controlled uses specific starters
